website_summaries.verdict: A good quality food prep and storage option that resists leaking and is microwave, freezer, and dishwasher safe.
pros: These stand out for having plenty of food storage space, stacking well, and being easy to clean as well as leakproof
Owners praise the quality and convenience, as well as how easy they are to grab and take on the go
cons: Issues with the lids being difficult to open and occasionally chipping

customer_reviews.title: Save money and buy it. You'll be thankfull
customer_reviews.text: if you want to save money in the long term and eat healthier Buy this product and recommend it. i cut out 2 hrs on sunday to meal prep. I make enough food for 3 work days and save me a bundle. breakfast $10 bucks mid day snack $10 bucks / lunch $ 10 buck. Plus factor in drive time to get your unhealthier grub/ waiting in line. And most of the time the order is wrong :). all i do is pop my food in microwave and bam. I know its cooked right and will taste good enough :). when i get home just throw it in the dishwasher and done.
customer_reviews.author: amazonmember

customer_reviews.title: I have wasted hundreds of dollars ion the typical products sold at ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm absolutely thrilled with the quality of these dishes. I have wasted hundreds of dollars ion the typical dish products sold at the grocery store, Target , & Walmart. After posting my meals on social media I've already been asked where did you get those dishes and are they worth it? YES and posted the link. I'm excited and plan to get more in various sizes. I've hand washed, microwaved, frozen, dishwashed and they are still like new! As a thank you they put in an extra dish set. How cool is that!!! Chain stores aren't personable like this company. They have a loyal customer in me! :)
customer_reviews.author: Monica Walters

customer_reviews.title: Great prep containers
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. They hold more food than my previous meal prep containers and I got more of them for a lower price. If I had to point something negative out I would say that the seal is incredibly strong. I know it's good to have a strong seal to ensure freshness and whatnot but, seriously, I feel like I have to use a crowbar to get the things open sometimes. Doesn't bother me enough to give it any less than 5 stars, though.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Quality
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and stack-ability of these containers, but the quality isn't great. After a single use, the lip of the base has cracked on multiple containers. I ordered 16 right before Thanksgiving, have used 8, and 3 already have cracked bases (see photo). Edited: I increased the number of stars for a couple reasons. 1. The Fitpacker folks contacted me and replaced the containers that had broken and 2. The replacement containers seem to be holding up much better, so perhaps the quality has improved since my initial purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect meal prep containers
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these containers for my meal preps! and they fit perfectly in my 6pack bag!
customer_reviews.author: Sporty Mom

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic containers for bulk cooking!
customer_reviews.text: I use these containers for bulk cooking and they are wonderful! The lid is a little hard to get off, which can be a pain, but it also means your food is properly sealed. I froze a bunch of meals in those containers, defrosted them in the fridge, popped them in the microwave and they came out great. I ordered two sets already and couldn't be happier with them! The seller also throws in an extra container, which is awesome. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Birgit

customer_reviews.title: Compact, stackable containers
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to be more healthy with what I eat and this is a big start to it. Being able to just grab food in the morning instead of being lazy and grabbing an unhealthy take out lunch during the day is definitely helping. The containers stack nicely in the fridge and are pretty compact. When empty, the stack of containers and lids is also pretty small and fits well in the cabinet. While the containers can be a little hard to open, I'm okay with that because they seem to form a pretty tight seal.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Must have item for meal prepping!
customer_reviews.text: So I've used these every single day since my purchase and I love them. I freeze them, bring them to work, freeze them again and pop them in the microwave (without the lid). My food comes out great every single time. I currently have my freezer full of them because I ordered two sets to get me through the month (I truly love to meal prep). You do need to be careful with opening the lid one of my containers cracked which is a bummer but I'm going to use it until it's truly no good. I have recommended these to friends and family!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Could be better. They feel like the Walmart ones actually maybe ...
customer_reviews.text: Could be better. They feel like the Walmart ones actually maybe a bit cheaper will update once I start using them more . Update: I started using these more recently for my meal preps and the lids are a competle NIGHTMARE. I bought a lot of veggies and every time I try to open the lid it spits them out everywhere. As I said Walmart ones would be better as they actually have a LIP to open/close easier. Very disappointed in purchase. Just by using them they break please AVOID
customer_reviews.author: Victor H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Durability!
customer_reviews.text: These are great containers! I recently started the Keto Diet and these have been really convenient for meal prepping. They don't warp in the microwave or dishwasher like other containers. I have been using them over and over again: packing, microwaving, dishwashing, and they still look brand new! I don't even have any tubberware in the house anymore for my lunches. These are all I use. I would definitely recommend these for your meal preps!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Zwiefelhofer

customer_reviews.title: These are AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: These are AWESOME!!!! I don't meal plan as hard core as other people. However, these are great to replace all your Tupperware. Why? Because they're all the same size, they stack, and all the lids fit on each other! The sizing is perfect: you can really fit a lot, or you can thrown in leftovers, and the containers themselves do not take up much space. AND DID I MENTION THEY STACK! I cannot tell you how great these are because i go through phases where I meal plan everything. Yet, during the phases I'm not meal planning... I still use these. When you get these, you'll throw away your tupperware because there's no need for them with this.
customer_reviews.author: Erikka

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first meal prep kit and I am very happy with these containers. I didn't want to keep using our normal food containers for meal prepping but I was concerned that these types of plastic containers wouldn't hold up. I've had them for a week now and I've put them through their first run and they are looking really good. These should be fine in the dishwasher as stated, it also helps that the type of dishwasher (Bosch) I have doesn't apply direct heat so it should t warp these at all. These are inexpensive and worth the small investment if your serious about meal prepping. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Lomeli

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for portion control.
customer_reviews.text: Works great to meal prep for planned weightloss. Having 1 day all about cooking and meals on hand and ready is helping my husband lose weight finally after 20 years. 1 container was cracked in shipping but I just tossed it. They hold up well to freezing and reheating.. haven't tried the dishwasher with them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I use these to make and freeze make-ahead dinners. While some have complained about having trouble with getting the lids off after being the the freezer, I suggest letting them sit outside on the counter for about 5 minutes, then open slightly before putting in the microwave; no trouble with the lid. These are a great size for holding a meat, veggies, and a side dish for freezing and then cooking in the microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Winnie

customer_reviews.title: Great product and fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Great product and fast shipping. They arrived packed well and the container has been great for meal prepping. It is sturdy and works well for lunches to take to work. I haven't put it through the dishwasher yet, but I have microwaved it and it hasn't changed shape or anything. The tops snap on easily and they are sealed tight. I know people were complaining about the tops being hard to get off and I can see that, but I'd rather have the container be sealed really well so it doesn't spill than having to work a little to snap them off. Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Cara Case

customer_reviews.title: Convenient for my meal prep
customer_reviews.text: I really love these containers. They are a great size and thicker plastic than my old ones. I fill them with my meals I prep for the week, and keep some in the freezer and some in the fridge. I also microwave them regularly with no issues, they're really great. The only issue with this container is that is seals really well, almost too well, it takes quite a bit of work to get the open, but I don't mind it because that means they're less likely to leak.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria AndrewsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for a few months & most of them have held up well. A couple cracked & the lids can be tricky to get off. But the size is great for meal prep stuff & they're also handy to store leftovers of any kind. I wouldn't say they're air-tight because they will leak if you have a lot of liquid (or maybe this just happened over time & the lids don't fit as well). Overall a worthwhile purchase. Also got the ones with 2 sections & those seem to be a little thicker plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey G.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nearly impossible to get lids off
customer_reviews.text: (Wife here). I'm sure I'd love these if I could just get the lid off! Luckily I have fingernails, but I won't for long if I keep having to use them to get these lids off. There's no tab on the corner to push up on and there's barely a lip on the lid. You have to dig your fingernails between the lid and the container in order to pull the lid away from the container. The lids are so stiff that when you get one tab undone on one end, as soon as you pull up on the other end, the first tab snaps back into place. If anyone has an tips/advice on easily removing the lids, please share!
customer_reviews.author: Guy S.

customer_reviews.title: Would be 5 star if consistent
customer_reviews.text: On their own, each of these containers are great. I have both the single and dual compartment fitpackers and they have held up great. The only ones that have been damaged were frozen and then I opened them while still frozen, or dropped them; totally understandable. I purchased another set to restock the containers and replace the broken ones, but then received a different product/style. I have ordered these twice and received different products, albeit being the same item number and the picture shows a single style. Both are great products, however, since they are different, I can't stack them together or use them interchangeably, which is why I ordered the exact same product.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: thanks, I hate them
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy these twice because the first set got stolen from my porch. If I knew they were this bad I wouldn't have stressed out over getting another set. I was hoping for something like takeout container quality or better, but these are worse. The edges are kind of sharp and very uncomfortable to open. Oh and opening them? Yeah, have fun with that. They're a pain to open when you've completely snapped them shut. When it comes from the freezer it feels like it's just going to shatter like glass. And opening them when they're hot from the microwave. One of them cracked on me today after using it for the first time. I HATE THEM.
customer_reviews.author: kittydorkdork

customer_reviews.title: Maybe okay for Single Use Only
customer_reviews.text: Quality is lacking. Don't stand up to washing, microwaving, freezing, or maybe something else? We're down to less than half of the original containers as the bottoms (black part) end up splintering or cracking upon opening. I'll go back to purchasing the Evolutionize containers, which are less expensive and apparently stand up to the job better overall.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G.

customer_reviews.title: On second thought.....updated
customer_reviews.text: They seem sturdy and the lid fits well. My kids are in college and plan to use them to heat leftovers in. Happy with purchase Update: Now that I have had them awhile, I would not purchase again. As others have stated, the lids are very difficult to open up and now some of my lids are cracking.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good product, but doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: At first I really loved these. Still do in a way, they're freezer and microwave friendly, perfectly sized and stack well...however the lids are so tight that they're impossible to get on and off. I waited a few months to let them hopefully wear in a little, but instead they've just started to crack and split and break from the super tight lids being pulled off. Other than that, they've really helped meal prepping and eating better, but it's frustrating for the price that I might have to throw most of them out.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Not the best in terms of durability.
customer_reviews.text: Update: up until today at least 5 containers have now broken due to the lids being extremely tight. Pieces of the edge of the containers are snapping off and flinging into the food, which then has to be thrown away because I cannot always fond the plastic pieces. Save your money. The extra container thrown in was nice, but I didn't expect to be throwing so many away after a single use. Decent containers. As tightly as the lids fit, I'd have expected a bit better leak control. The lids on some are wicked hard to get off. I'd prefer a smaller container, but this is fine.
customer_reviews.author: thempteacher

customer_reviews.title: after much use, they all leak now.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for 10 months now. At first they worked well. good size for a single meal, and they sealed well enough. After much use, and washing, things have changed, and they are now worthless. None of them seal anymore. I carry them in my work bag everyday, and the whole idea is that they don't leak all over my work stuff. Well, none of them seal properly anymore, and they all leak, so i have to put them in ziplocs now. this totally defeats my purpose. I would not buy these again, nor recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Cracked bottoms
customer_reviews.text: The Fitpacker meal prep containers are perfect for keeping meals on hand. They are just the right size as you can add as little or as much as you want. They hold quite a bit if desired. I love how I can freeze food then be able to pop it into the microwave for a couple minutes or so. UPDATE: After using these Fitpacker meal prep containers I find that the black bottoms will crack when trying to remove the lid while the food is still frozen. Quite a few of them broke this way. Also the freezer food ends up with freezer burn after awhile. I will look for something else. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: MarthaSG

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t basically any other disposable take away container that has been marketed as meal prep boxes. They are fairly cheap and don’t last a very long time. I bought this two years ago and I have around 2 left. Some warnings to keep in mind is that they’re not very leak proof especially over time as you use it. Do not put them in the freezer or they will become brittle and break. If you put greasy food in these containers... good luck washing them out. They hold onto food grease like no other. Will probably buy Pyrex containers in the future instead of cheaping out.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: LEAK! Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought these at a higher price since they said American made and seemed to be great quality based on the reviews. However, I had a very small amount of liquid in my container and it leaked out when I held it on its side. Another reviewer said that it is the same model number on the bottom as the ones you get from take out. All in all I'm not sure if there are ones that don't leak and I'm not sure that there are ones that are much better quality. But I definitely don't want to pay a higher price for for these which appear to be the same quality as all others.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie K

customer_reviews.title: Great for meal-prepping
customer_reviews.text: Have been using run-of-the-mill tupperware containers from Kroger and no longer am able to pour the contents into another bowl for lunch at work. These containers are great because I can portion my meals out after they've cooled and stick them in the freezer for storing. Once I'm ready to eat, I'll thaw the meal and stick right into the microwave in the same container with the lid slightly open. I've not used these a lot but they seem a touch sturdier than the takeout containers of the same style. These will be a better alternative to just using tupperware and am very happy I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Rico Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to open, cracked half of them :(
customer_reviews.text: I've literally thrown half of these guys in the trash!!! They are very durable, but near impossible to open. I bought them at the request of my personal trainer who uses then and recommends them for meal prep. On our first prep, he couldn't open most of them, and he's a bodybuilder..😐 I cracked 3 my first day. I thought they would be more flexible and agreeable after a wash or two and I've since broken about 10 more. I want to support Fitpacker, but I'm out 35 bucks giving them a chance. Maybe this was a bad batch, I dunno, but I'm on to better brands.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trusty meal prep container
customer_reviews.text: Excellent meal prep container for the price point. Durable and does what is advertised. Got this as update and moving into bulking from one of the smaller versions (I believe the 16 oz.), which I had purchased in late 2016, with all 17 (they give a free container away) mostly intact save 2 lids with part of it chipped off (but still functional and sealed).
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: they break easy
customer_reviews.text: They were seemed great at first although soon after receiving them I noticed them starting to break and crack. It's been about 6 months and almost all 16 from the 2 compartment and 16 from the single compartment containers have broken. I'm not sure why I went with these vs the others on Amazon for a little more money but I regret it. I would spend a little more if you want something that will last longer. I'm not sure how they have so many 5 star reviews based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to stack when filled and not filled in cabinet
customer_reviews.text: Easy to stack when filled and not filled in cabinet, microwaves well and dishwasher top rack. Seem very sturdy plastics but no BPA important to me. Lids a little difficult to open with no protruding tab but just start slow and don't yank especially when cold or frozen. These appear similar to the containers when I was on Seattle Sutton foods. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: crystalgeyser

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and durable
customer_reviews.text: They are ideal for portion control, for taking lunch to the office or storing away food. Stays true to form in the microwave, did not warp and just as worthy coming out of the freezer. The price is great also. All around great buy. Update: Dec 11. I still stand by the good features outlined above. However with daily usage I encountered the following problem: There is no tag to lift the lid open as a result ( especially when frozen when )one tries to open the container , one has to lift so hard that it eventually breaks the lip on the side. They need to add to corner lift.
customer_reviews.author: Mamie

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: I bought these containers to start prepping meals. I like that they are dishwasher/freezer/microwave safe and they are a decent size, however, they are extremely difficult to open once closed - especially when taken out of the freezer. One arrived with an inside corner all broken out, so that one was thrown out. Pieces have chipped off 2 trying to open them, so those are gone as well. These are not working for me so will look for another type of container to try. I will find another purpose for them.
customer_reviews.author: Fearnocolor

customer_reviews.title: Great price, but they don't last long
customer_reviews.text: Great price, but they don't last long. The lids are incredibly difficult to get off. After just 2 weeks, many of the containers because to chip at the edges and crack. I have had rubbermaid containers in use for years that don't suffer from these types of problems. Granted, you get what you pay for in regard to price. We ended up finding similar containers at Costco that are much better made, and threw all of these out.
customer_reviews.author: OlaM

customer_reviews.title: Just handle the containers carefully to keep them in good shape for as long as possible.
customer_reviews.text: Love the containers fory trying to prepare make ahead meals in proportion amounts, The containers are not very strong, I just try and handle them carefully when washing and re-using. When they begin to tear, I won't mind ordering another set. I get at least a year or more use out of the containers, so when it's time to replace them, I won't mind at all and I heartily recommend them for meal planning.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered the product twice, and overall I really like the size and convenience of the product. However, the last set of containers I got really started to fall apart right away. Due to the way that they fasten/seal the plastic sides break off frequently. Even quicker than the first set I bought. Disappointing. The price, however, does make it worth buying again because of the amount you get, and how they stack in the refrigerator. I wish the company would look at durability. I am a customer that does not wash them in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M. Vogt

customer_reviews.title: ... freezer safe) these containers become extremely brittle and break super easy. The first time I used these in ...
customer_reviews.text: when these are put in the freezer (as stated in the description that they are freezer safe) these containers become extremely brittle and break super easy. The first time I used these in the freezer, when removing from the freezer, the lid and side cracked and broke when I tried to take the lid off. This happened with THREE of them!! I am so disappointed in this product. I plan on purchasing a similar product from another company so that I can actually have useable containers that are able to be frozen
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L. Manning

customer_reviews.title: Stackable and freezer proof.
customer_reviews.text: These things have completely transformed my cooking. If you’re like me a struggle with “proper meal prep” you’re in good hands knowing these are freezer proof and don’t take up too much space in the fridge. Sometimes I just cook enough meat for 2 weeks and throw half in the freezer and decide on sides later. I barely have all 16 in use at once. But on the occasions that I do a proper prep these are more than enough. I didn’t rate the leak proof b/c I don’t eat a lot of super wet foods. So I don’t know.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Seems sturdy but still cracked fairly quickly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these based on the reviews and comparison with similar meal prep containers. The containers and lids feel pretty substantial and seemed to be of better quality than the previous brand I purchased. I also like the size of them and how secure the lids sealed the containers. However, within only 2 weeks of using these containers, 2 have already cracked (the containers, not the lids). We hand wash all our dishes and are pretty careful when opening and closing the containers. Overall, I’d say the quality is fair but not great. I likely won’t purchase them again due to the quality, unless they are improved upon.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Quality was great last year but not anymore
customer_reviews.text: I made a review around last year on the quality of these containers as they were going strong. I decided this year to buy more because I needed a fresh new set. I don’t know what happened to the quality but all of them are cracking at the edges. I made sure I washed them correctly, microwaved them correctly. Nothing was working. I even bought more thinking that batch was just a fluke. I am so sad in even thinking of finding a new company to buy containers. I loved these containers but the quality has went downhill. I tried to message them but got no reply. It’s time for me to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Seattlelover23

customer_reviews.title: NOT LEAK PROOF!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok my first time using this product. The durability is good. You can wash them in the dishwashing machine and they maintain their shape and everything. The reason I am giving it 1 star rating is because if you read the description it says they are LEAK proof. They are not. I bought this company’s carrying bag also and I put them in at 430am. By 6 am in an easy train ride the bottom of the bag was soaked with what was stored inside the containers. No it wasn’t soup or anything that would qualify as overly liquid. Just simple simple brown rice, vegetables and chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Ddgalarza

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean but are durable, handy
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for over 2 years and I think maybe only 3 of them have cracked on me. I use them them every week for portioning food for my diet. The lids clamp on tightly and hold in liquids pretty well. They aren't leak proof but they do a better job than other products out there. Worth the money. Microwave safe but I don't nuke stuff with the lids on. Hand wash everything too. They are a pain to dry but otherwise no issues.
customer_reviews.author: NBA Films

customer_reviews.title: Excellent container for make-ahead meals
customer_reviews.text: Love these containers. I've tried several different containers for making and freezing soups. All of them have had problems ranging from warping to cracking to difficulties with stacking. I tried the Fitpacker containers and I had no issues. They stacked beautifully in the freezer, there was no damage from freezing, and they thawed and reheated without any issues. When I reheated the soup in the microwave it didn't boil over the sides of the container. The lid also fit tightly so nothing was spilled when moving the container around. Now I've ordered the Fitpacker meal management bag so that I can have my lunch and snacks nicely packed each day for lunch.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy S. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: The packaging was really good but one of the bottoms was broken in my ...
customer_reviews.text: These seem a lot easier to pack, store and remember than normal Tupperware did for me. These are cheap and convenient. The packaging was really good but one of the bottoms was broken in my package. The packaging (box wise) was superb so it was probably from before packaging. Thankfully they included "an extra one" in the package so even with a broken one I still have a full set of what I purchased. I am not positive on durability but so far I must say that given the convenience and price I will probably not be too disappointed as long as they last more than 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye

customer_reviews.title: Very tight-fitting lids
customer_reviews.text: I used these containers for freezer food prep. I prepped 2 weeks worth of meals. The containers hold a good amount of food per meal. The downside is the lids are rigid and fit very tight making them difficult to remove and a few broke while trying to remove them after having been in the freezer. I would really like them except for the problem removing the lids.
customer_reviews.author: Readsinidaho

customer_reviews.title: Perfect durable containers
customer_reviews.text: I waited to write a review until these containers had been in use for a while so I could see how they would hold up. It has now been 2 months of daily use, and the containers have exceeded expectations. They are extremely sturdy, don't leak, and survive the top rack of the dishwasher without injury. A couple of them have developed some 'blistering' on the inside where a bit of oil overheated during microwaving...difficult to avoid this unless you never put them in the microwave. I also freeze ready-to-eat meals in them, take them to work frozen & let them thaw until lunch. Again, I have nothing but praise for these containers...except I wish they came in purple.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jolly

customer_reviews.title: Fitpacker Meal Prep Containers
customer_reviews.text: Product is able to be used in freezer and microwave (with lid off). Easy care by hand washing or top shelf dishwasher safe. Some difficulty getting lid off because they snap tight and there is no tab that will allow easier removal. So far I have no other complaint. Will purchase again. Quality product. Food safe.
customer_reviews.author: Mike E.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these in October and about 5 of them are already damaged. I had originally placed an order in 2017 and the units seemed to last and were durable but decided to replace them and these new ones have not last not even half the life the other ones did. I’m disappointed because I use these weekly and will now have to purchase elsewhere. Won’t be a returning customer here again.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian P

customer_reviews.title: The containers are fantastic! Very durable
customer_reviews.text: The containers are fantastic! Very durable, they don't leak and they fit my portions perfectly. Definitely a product worth investing in!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered these before years ago and only die to Tupperware thieves I’ve had to replace them. This new batch is noticeably cheaper quality. Over half of them have cracked on the rim and it’s only been a couple of weeks, the lids on these are crazy hard to get off without hurting your fingers, and the lids don’t snap all the way on some containers. Overall I’m sad to say they were a waste of money. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: vmt1385

customer_reviews.title: These are a game changer.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to meal prep forever, but I didn't have the right tools for the job. These containers do a great job. I make up my lunches for a couple of weeks and put them in the freezer. You have to realize that they aren't going to last forever, especially microwaving them often, but they are holding on well. Some people complain that they are hard to open, and there is some merit to that, but it beat the alternative. I've dropped them more than once and no spills yet.
customer_reviews.author: A Guy That Buys Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Easy affordable meal prep
customer_reviews.text: Great storage containers to help make meals prep a no brainer. I need something easy it or I won’t do it. This is it! Nice tight fit with the kids, fits in my lunch box making lunches at work a snap. Very affordable and easy to clean. I haven’t microwaved anything just yet, nor had any issues with leaking containers. Washes it all in the dishwasher first and no warping of lids. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Enders

customer_reviews.title: Great for portion control
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a smaller container to make and freeze meals all in one container. I wish there was one size smaller or a lid that would fit a lot closer to the container. I get ice buildup but no freezer burn. The tops are incredibly difficult to remove, and impossible when frozen. I take the meal out the morning of and place in the refrigerator so the lid comes off easier.
customer_reviews.author: Natures Retreat

customer_reviews.title: Good for Bulking Season
customer_reviews.text: For those of you who lift, and are in a cutting or bulking phase, you already know how good these are. For those of you who don’t, y’all are posers - probably don’t even know what a Boulder is. It’s nice how they tell you how many ounces each container holds, but I wish they would tell me how many macros each one holds - I’m looking for those gains, am I right?
customer_reviews.author: Evan Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 10 microwave/dishwasher cycles, then fell apart at the edges. What's interesting is that we bought the separated container type from the same company (which seem to be thicker/better made) and they are still going strong and we actually use them more often. This item, unfortunately, started falling apart pretty quick. I would NOT recommend these to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: They're super cheap which I like. They're the right size, which I also like. They send you an extra one which is pretty coo. That's about all I like about these. They are ridiculously flimsy. They are difficult to open. For the price though, I'm okay with them and I'll deal with the fact that they're all going to be chipped by the end of the first month. Still a 3 star for how flimsy it is and how bad it is attempting to open it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazn customer

customer_reviews.title: Eating Fit Fast
customer_reviews.text: Get immediate portion control fast with Fitpacker. Each container fits a reasonable amount of food for a 1 person meal. Make ahead salads and healthy meals which stay fresh in this leakproof, microwavable and dishwasher safe container. Love the convenient containers with the built in portion control. The ease of making up lunches and dinners ahead of time just got so fast and easy. Thank you..
customer_reviews.author: K. CoCo

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, cheap, and easy to wash.
customer_reviews.text: I love these containers. They are mostly spill proof. It makes meal prepping super convenient. They also fit well in the top rack of the dishwasher so they are easy to clean without taking up a ton of space in the washer. And they are cheap enough that if I have to throw one away once in a while it’s no big deal. They hold up pretty well but do crack after 10-20 uses, I would guess.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Works and first and then breaks after about six weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I am adjusting my rating based on usage. I have been using these since August. I meal prep every week. I hand wash my containers. They do seal tight, and hold good portion. However, I have had to throw away seven containers in the past week, due to the lip on the bottom half of the container cracking or breaking off. I would normally say this is a random one off, but this was seven. It feels a bit too unsafe. I am now trying Fitpacker Pro for better endurance.
customer_reviews.author: Dwaine

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Open makes them a no go for me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to LOVE these containers. I started a workout/meal plan and needed to prep my food. These containers seemed perfect. The bottom line is they are VERY hard to open and that results in cracks/tears in the bottom container (black bottom piece). What I do need to say is they have great customer service because when I had torn containers within a week of buying these the company replaced what broke and a few extra. Sadly, they are just way to hard to open and close and I'm not happy with the purchase. I hope they can get a better version because this company seems to be really awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Hersh

customer_reviews.title: perfect way to organize meal planning and making life simple
customer_reviews.text: I have fought with tupperware for years. No lids, turn ugly in dishwasher. Fitzpacker stacks so nicely in storage, lids fit, perfect size for 2 people. I freeze meals for my busy professional adult children and they stack so well in the freezer. Its really fun for me and easy to prepare so many different meals and organize them so Im not standing on my head fighting with all different sized containers in my freezer. BPA free! Can put them in the microwave. They have made cooking fun again, I cant say enough about them. Great find!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how these have a 4 star, the plastic is quite thin and breaks under normal usage. Getting the lids off is a challenge, you have to fight with it then end up breaking either the lid or the bottom. I expected a lot more for a USA made product, which is what attracted me to it in the first place. They also leak if not kept horizontal. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good until....
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely pleased with my meal prepping containers (used for just about 2 weeks) until I popped the lid off and the corner of the container broke off. Now I thought this was an anomaly until the very next container I opened did the exact same thing :/ --- this was not frozen, kept in the fridge and actually contained salad (so not hot to cold).I would love some insight into why this happened, help me out fitpacker :/
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Just got these and the company was awesome. I love the containers and they actually lock together when placed on top of one another but the packing away storage is also nice because they take up minimal space. they gave me an extra container just for appreciation of my order! Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: -They are excellent for meal prepping except for one thing
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these things for a little over an year. Here are my thoughts: -They are excellent for meal prepping except for one thing, no compartments for separation. I have had multiple times where my green beans had some water still on them and they soaked my other food. -They are durable until the edges start to chip after constant use. It is plastic after all. -After the edges start to go, they turn into safety issues. Opening these containers isn't easy because all around the edges is a sharp ledge you pull up on. Once they become serrated, its basically a knife. -They are great for stacking in a small space.
customer_reviews.author: Alex green

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product anymore
customer_reviews.text: We bought a pack in 2016 and loved them... But in 2019 when we needed more, we were very disappointed in the containers. Something changed and the fit and quality is not good. Especially for the price, I would not buy these again. The lids don't fit or break when pulling them off. They are now very cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Biggs

customer_reviews.title: Good solid containers, tight seal...but.....
customer_reviews.text: I like these containers a lot, but I KEEP BREAKING THEM! I meal prep all of my food, and usually freeze it. DO NOT TRY TO REMOVE LID WHEN THE CONTAINER IS FROZEN! The plastic is brittle and snaps and breaks :((( I wish these were a little more durable because I really do want to love them. They are good size, and feel solid and lid seals secure. At this rate I will need to re-order in a few months (Ive broken 3!)
customer_reviews.author: RoyWilkinson

customer_reviews.title: They Last!
customer_reviews.text: I've used the same fitpacker containers for about two years now and have only recently broken one (my own error, not the product) and goodness knows I don't treat them delicately. I actually want to buy the newer ones but I can't justify the expense because the ones I have are perfectly fine. I even bought a set for my brother. I'm hooked, and will never buy another brand of meal prep containers.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole K

customer_reviews.title: ... ordering any sort of meal prep Tupperware and I love these. When they arrived they were actually a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time ordering any sort of meal prep Tupperware and I love these . When they arrived they were actually a little bit bigger than I thought they would be which was perfect for me and their the perfect size for all my meals. They stack very well and condense down to be a pretty reasonable stack when you're not using them. I ordered 2 boxes of them and I'll probably order another one soon. They've been great for taking to work or eating at home. I'd definitely recommend them if you're getting into large scale meal planning.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Rofidal

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I think about each one, you get about 5-10 uses out of them until the start falling apart and cracking. It is now September 2020 and i have about 5 left that work. They provide a tight seal and its great for organizing but they arent going to last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Roadhouse25

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: These containers are very well made! I use them everyday for lunch and seem to hold up very well in the microwave or freezer. Just be sure to open the container a little bit before microwaving and your good. I had a minor problem with Amazon's packaging (not the seller) and contacted Fitpacker to help me out. They came through and exceeded my expectations from a company. If you need something strong to portion out your foods, this is the right product for you! These containers stack beautifully too! It is a huge help especially when moving them around the fridge while stacked.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Hard to open and several are broken
customer_reviews.text: These are a great size for meal prep and portions. They stack easily in the fridge. However, they are extremely difficult to open and several have broken/chipped edges from trying to open them. Also, I thought they were supposed to be freezer-safe but one cracked after being in the freezer. (Perhaps that was another brand I had researched?) I probably will not buy these again even though the size is good. I will just try some others -- maybe some that have portioned spaces.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Just what I needed for meal prepping! (meals can actually fit in the fridge now)
customer_reviews.text: Great value for your money. These are perfect and exactly as described by the seller. Also - the company is awesome and truly engaged with the goals of their customer to live a healthier lifestyle. I always say support the niche players because you will get better service, and this was the case with Fitpaker. I'll be a returning customer!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Saunders

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again even with a few nitpicky complaints
customer_reviews.text: This meal prep container is nice for the price there are some great things that I love and a few small complaints. Pros -They are well made and study -They do well in the microwave as advertised -Can handle the dishwasher as advertised but sometimes come out slightly warped, but that being said it doesn't affect the function of the containers. Cons -Sometimes they are easily opened and others its a massive fight -Depending on what you put in them I have an odd issue with something almost becoming embedded in the container even with some dawn and scrubbing it doesn't seem to want to come clean...weird Overall I am happy with the purchase and would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Josiah Rawlings

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price! Buying more.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to open but other then that these are great and I will be buying more! I already have them in two styles and this is pretty much all I use in my house now. I saw others complain about them turning white and such and yes they can do that But so does every other plastic container so not sure you can really be mad at them.
customer_reviews.author: YourHandsUntied

customer_reviews.title: Do not stand up to re-use. Difficult to open.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good size Work well for single use Cons: Difficult to open especially when cold. Condensation or food liquid sprays all over when the lid finally pops off. The edges crack when it is being opened - sometimes this will even happen on the first use of the container. More likely to happen with cold containers (from fridge or freezer). Leak pretty badly. I am currently throwing away these containers after I'm done using them because opening them is such a pain and they break so often. I'm tired of stained clothes from the food liquid spraying me when I open the lids.
customer_reviews.author: T. A.

customer_reviews.title: These work so well for food storage
customer_reviews.text: I love fit packers - I have two sizes now. I have a large garden and prepare the things I grow into meals for storage. Fit packers can go from the freezer to the microwave and they store so well - they don't waste any space in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Gainer

customer_reviews.title: NOT DISHWASHER SAFE
customer_reviews.text: Even on the lightest wash setting on my dishwasher machine, several of my Fitpackers were damaged after a quick wash. Pieces of the protective coating on the inside are chipping away (see pic). I'm worried that it's not safe to use them in that condition anymore, so I've had to throw them out. I bought them as a Christmas present for myself but it's disappointing to see that they did not hold up as long as I thought. Overall, they've worked perfectly fine up until now.
customer_reviews.author: Noella Mai

customer_reviews.title: Lids are very hard to take off, one broke on second use
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Stacks amazing, microwaveable, you can fit a ton in these Cons: You will break a fingernail opening these packages. It is super hard to open these without digging your fingernails under the plastic rim and pulling up. A lid just broke when being lifted off the packaging, because it was so tightly adhered to the container. These are not what they're cracked up to be. Will be looking for meal prep containers that are easier to open.
customer_reviews.author: JRoz

customer_reviews.title: Great portability but the durability factor is HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the size & seal on these containers. They are amazing for stacking in your fridge or lunch box. However, 30% of the time I open one of them, the plastic chips off of the side. Pretty ridiculous considering its not like these are 10 cent disposable containers. I hope the company does something about the defect. I really love the containers BESIDES opening them and getting angry every time. Such shame.
customer_reviews.author: JenM

customer_reviews.title: Better than described!
customer_reviews.text: These came perfect with no damage. The lids are tight and have quality so that they don't crack. Take your time removing the lids so that you don't break them. The seal is excellent which can put some pressure. Took a box of these to a party for leftovers to be taken home and they worked out perfect. No mess and no worries about getting any containers back. Will order these again.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Launiu

customer_reviews.title: Useful, but check your lids!
customer_reviews.text: Great containers for advance meal prep, but the some of the lids are a bit tight and really difficult to take off. I actually had to use a butter knife as a prying tool and then invert a couple of the corners on one of the lids to get it to come off! None of the other lids have given me that much trouble, so it could be a manufacturing defect on just that one. I didn't contact customer service about it because they sent an extra lid and container in the package and really, it's not a super huge deal to me. It is the reason I couldn't give this product 5 stars, though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. Ever
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible I don't know why they are getting such great reviews. Almost half of ours is broken, and there isn't a lip for you to easily open it. The kids aren't microwaveable so when I went to eat up my food the lid melted on one set. Such a waste of my money! Not pleased wish I could get a refund! Do not buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hoce

customer_reviews.title: Liked them so much I ordered them again
customer_reviews.text: My husband had purchased these in the past for his meal-prep lunches, so I was already a fan. I am now doing a lot of Sunday meal prepping for the week and these are the perfect size for a generous portion. They can be a little challenging to open, but they seal very well and keep very fresh in the fridge and lunchbox, and they stack very neatly to take up little space inthe fridge. I have not tried these in the freezer, but they microwave well with no warping. I'm very happy with the quality and highly recommend these containers.
customer_reviews.author: OT

customer_reviews.title: Great containers, exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Great containers, exactly what I was looking for. They fit into my meal prep lunch box and they are higher quality than the ones that ISO and 6Pack sell, for a much better price. My only complaint is the lids are very hard to get off, but I understand that that's the sacrifice I'm making for my food not spilling everywhere (EDIT: John told me the "secret" of how to properly take the lids off, now I just feel silly!) So far they hold up very well to using a fork and knife with them, and being put in the dishwasher. I will definitely be a returning customer!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but hard to open.
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent meal prep containers in almost every way. They are a good size and stack well. They take up very little space when empty. But I had to knock off 2 stars because they are a pain in the neck to open. I though it might be just me, then my wife complained about the difficulty she had as well. I don't need that frustration at work.. or anytime I have a meal. I was going to buy another set. The company was very generous in adding an extra container to the 16 count set. But I am going to try another brand because of the difficult way they open.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody

customer_reviews.title: Super Great Product... you need to buy this
customer_reviews.text: These are great for food storage. The problem with a lot of food storage things is space. You know what I mean, everyone has that cupboard that is full of containers and lids, etc. Who has space for more. Well, these stack up real nice and a lot of them take minimal space. And then they lock in the food nice and give you a lot of space for a lot of food. Enough said! Just click "Buy now"!
customer_reviews.author: HappyC

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great quality. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: We first ordered a 16 pack of these in September of 2017, we like them so much we went ahead and ordered another 16-pack in October of 2017. They are just now getting to the point where they need to be replaced, so we ordered our third 16-pack. We have refrigerated, microwaved, and washed in the dishwasher. We even use the smaller ones to pack our toddler's snacks. We aren't exactly gentle on these containers and never had any issues. We will definitely continue buying this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: ) These break fairly easily. They're strong
customer_reviews.text: My wife purchased a giant pack of these after reading all of the positive reviews, but these are lacking in two major ways: 1.) These are very difficult to open. There's no easy-to-pop-open lip on the side, so you have to pry at the edges for ~10 seconds just to open. Maybe another customer has discovered the secret, but I'm struggling. 2.) These break fairly easily. They're strong, but brittle, which is perhaps only a problem because we're prying so hard, contorting them to try to get them open. My wife seems to like them out of buyer's bias, or I'd push harder to scrap them all and buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: Great Prep Containers for the man on the go!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to provide meals to a cancer patient and have not received any back to know much about them, but I am happy that they can be heated in a microwave, then washed and reused. I am placing plastic wrap over the food to prevent freezer burn.
customer_reviews.author: james cutler

customer_reviews.title: Tight but leaky seal
customer_reviews.text: It's worth mentioning these are pretty difficult to open so much that one of my containers broke trying to open it. I read in a review that they didn't leak but that's not true. These are not leak proof, found that out after some egg juice leaked, yuck! Overall, decent bang for the buck. If you're on the fence over compartments, I will probably buy compartment ones once these need replacing. Update: I've had these several weeks and still use them every single day, and every single day unless I keep my lunchbox perfectly flat there's liquid leaked out. Super annoying to clean everyday. Looking for new ones.
customer_reviews.author: AMY

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to give these 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I used these to pack up Thanksgiving left overs. They were a perfect size and very sturdy. My only complaint was that on a few of them, when you went to take the clear top off, the edges of the black base would break off. I had little bits of black plastic on my counters and floors. Didn't bother washing, just tossed them.
customer_reviews.author: KMO

customer_reviews.title: Hard to open
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews on this product and was really excited about getting these. When they came I was surprised they didn't have a lip to make opening easier. This is the main reason for this low star review. It is SO DIFFICULT to open these! I cannot tell you how many times I have cut my finger trying to pry these open. Due to the prying, the sides have cracked and broken off. As for size, they work well for a 6-Pack bag. Portion control/ size of containers is a little large for my taste but it gets the job done. I truly wish these were a little more user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: Lids Hard to Remove
customer_reviews.text: Love these for my prep! Lids really stay on tight and container is the perfect size for that average prepped meal. It shipped very quickly. They are reasonable priced and of great quality. UPDATE: I've attempted to use these for awhile now but found that the lids stay on TOO tight. i could barely get them off and oftentimes the force needed to pull the top from the bottom would crack pieces off the bottom container. The black container cracks very easily and it was such work to get the tops off, i stopped using them for prep and just use them to store leftovers in my fridge sometimes. I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Bonita M. Glover

customer_reviews.title: Not what i expected
customer_reviews.text: With all the good reviews, I thought I was going to love these. I absolutely hate them and cannot wait to throw them away. I don't even want to keep them as backups. The covers are extremely difficult to get off, to the point where it literally hurts your hands when trying to take them off. Several of them have already had the covers crack, or the container part crack. I am not sure why they have such good reviews, because they really areally terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha B

customer_reviews.title: Alil fragile but great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Im not sure if it's my water or the containers but they seem to get a white residue on them after a machine wash. They are awesome for the price though and perfect for meal prep. I've had to throw a couple away due to the lids breaking but I've had them for over a year. Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Jaide

customer_reviews.title: All the lids have cracked
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of use, all of the lids have cracked. Some of the lids cracked the very first time I used them in the freezer. Dry food or a cooked meal that was cooled down before storing in the fitpacker, nothing I tried seemed to keep the lids from cracking. My freezer is not too cold either. In some cases, the plastic broke into tiny pieces making the meal inedible. I wanted to like and use these, but I am back to the more expensive, but sturdy pyrex food storage containers. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marc and Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Good for the most part.
customer_reviews.text: First off the price of this product for the amount you get is pretty great. Though when they say leak proof they really mean it, I can barely get the lids off when I want to eat my food they're so leak proof. I have broken one of the containers from trying to open it but other than that I have nothing bad to say about the containers.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Krejci

product_meta.title: Fitpacker Meal Prep Containers - 28oz Portion Control Lunch Bento Box - Reusable Microwaveable (16 Pack - Version 2)
feature_bullets: IDEAL FOR MEAL PREP AND PORTION CONTROL - Many food storage containers may look similar but they won't match the Fitpacker quality. Each container is the perfect size to manage your portions and help you to a healthy diet.
MADE IN THE USA - Safety should be a priority when it comes to food storage. Our industry approved plastic containers are certified BPA free and free of phthalates or any toxins.
FULLY REUSABLE - From FREEZER to MICROWAVE (no lid) to DISHWASHER, makes your meal prep easy so you can focus on what is important - enjoying your food.
CONVENIENT - Patented SureLock seal clicks into a close for leak resistance and fit perfectly in our Fitpacker Bags. These containers can also stack and nest together for space saving storage.
HAPPY CUSTOMERS - 100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEED or your money back. Our customer reviews speak for themselves and assure you your complete satisfaction.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars4,954 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
